title: Twilight Vampires
description: Test your knowledge of vampire lore!

questions.question: What is the ruling body of the vampire world called?
questions.explanation: The Volturi are the ancient vampire coven that enforces vampire law from Volterra, Italy.

questions.question: Who are the three leaders of the Volturi?
questions.explanation: Aro, Caius, and Marcus are the three ancient vampires who lead the Volturi.

questions.question: Newborn vampires are stronger than older vampires.
questions.explanation: Newborn vampires retain their human blood in their tissues, making them exceptionally strong but also volatile.

questions.question: What color are a vampire's eyes when they drink human blood?
questions.explanation: Vampires who drink human blood have red eyes, while those who drink animal blood have golden eyes.

questions.question: What happens during a vampire's transformation?

options.text: They experience intense burning pain for days

questions.explanation: The transformation takes 2-3 days of excruciating burning pain as the venom spreads through the body.

questions.question: What is Jane's terrifying ability?
questions.explanation: Jane can create the illusion of extreme pain in her victims, making her one of the Volturi's most feared members.

questions.question: Vampires in Twilight need to be invited into homes.
questions.explanation: Unlike traditional vampire lore, Twilight vampires don't need invitations to enter homes.

questions.question: What is an 'immortal child' and why are they forbidden?

options.text: A vampire child - they're too powerful and uncontrollable
A vampire who never ages mentally

questions.explanation: Immortal children are vampires turned as young children. They're forbidden because they can't control their instincts and exposed vampires.
